learningpod.title: Kaplan Kids (Conventions of Standard English): Context Clues

p.b: Unlike her more graceful sister, Claudia moved trumbily and was rarely invited to dance.

questionBody.p: Based on its role in the sentence, what can you tell about the nonsense word trumbily?

simpleChoice.p: The word trumbily is a proper noun, naming a dance Claudia performed.
The word trumbily is a verb, telling what Claudia did.
The word trumbily is an adjective, describing how Claudia looked.
The word trumbily is an adverb, describing how Claudia moved.
